claim: Recombinant HA antigens produced using BEVS have been shown to induce significantly higher levels of broadly cross-reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of HA compared with egg-derived vaccines.
explanation: CONSORT flow diagram showing enrollment, randomization, and vaccine allocation of participants over two influenza seasons (2018–2019 and 2019–2020) comparing cell culture–derived IIV4 (cclIV4), recombinant HA vaccine (RIV4), and egg-derived IIV4 vaccines (Fluzone and Fluarix). It details numbers enrolled, completed visits, re-randomization, and exclusions. The figure is a participant flow diagram and does not present any immunogenicity or antibody response data comparing recombinant HA vaccines to egg-derived vaccines, so it does not support the claim. Note: The image quality is adequate to determine content; however, no data on antibody levels or cross-reactivity are shown.

It details numbers enrolled, completed visits, re-randomization, and exclusions.
